title: Graphs of motion under resistive force

content.question: A car is traveling along a straight, level road when it runs out of gas at time t = 0. From this time on, the net force on the car is a resistive force of â€“kv, where v is velocity and k is a constant. Which of the following pairs of graphs best represents the speed v and position x of the car as functions of time after t = 0 ?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Choice A has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and decreases linearly until it reaches the x-axis. The position graph starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave up with an asymptote at the x-axis.

Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Choice B has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave up with an asymptote at the x-axis. The position graph is the same but less curved.

Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.  Choice C has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave down until it reaches the x-axis. The position graph starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down with a horizontal asymptote.

Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Choice D has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave up with an asymptote at the x-axis. The position graph starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down with a horizontal asymptote.

Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Choice E has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and decreases linearly until it reaches the x-axis. The position graph starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down with a horizontal asymptote.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each choice has a graph on the left with velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis, and a graph on the right with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Choice D has a velocity graph that starts at a point on the y-axis above the origin and is decreasing and concave up with an asymptote at the x-axis. The position graph starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down with a horizontal asymptote.
